title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 219-3.4 - Hydrogen chloride emissions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 219-3.4 - Hydrogen chloride emissions

State Regulations

No person may cause or allow a running three-hour average
emission of hydrogen chloride from any incinerator at a facility subject to
this Subpart in excess of 10 percent by weight of the uncontrolled emissions
(90 percent reduction) unless it is demonstrated that the stack concentration
is less than 50 parts per million by volume, dry basis, corrected to seven
percent oxygen; or the uncontrolled emission rate is less than four pounds per
hour and the total charging rate is less than 500 pounds per
hour. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
219-3.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
